ratings.rComments: Lectures are super boring and no past exams are given. Homework has no deep connection to exams. A lot of extra credits. Personally, not a fan of him.
Easy A. Just memorize slides/ vocab.

Love is a nice guy but he's super boring. I fell asleep in most lectures but you should still go to get the clicker points. Read the book before the exams. The material is super basic and mainly common sense but you have to know the terms he's looking for.

Lecture is pretty boring but you can get extra credit by showing up and doing the i-clickers. Make sure you read the textbook before exams, it will really help you out. He uses scenarios and hypothetical situations as most of the exam questions so you have to know how to apply the terms/topics and not just definitions.

Attendance is mandatory because you get iclicker points. Everything in this class is easy, but the exams are difficult. The actual material is not difficult. However, there are too many powerpoint slides and hundreds of definitions to memorize for each exam. Love is a great professor, and he is very kind. You'll love him!
All I can remember about Prof. Love is his pink shirts!!!! And the fact that his class is interesting with the relevant movie clips and iClicker questions kept me focused.

Basically, if you memorize all his slides you will get A's on his exams. Unfortunately, this is sometimes lots of material for one to digest easily in a short time span. Other than that, there is lots of opportunity for extra credit (can boost your grade by around 5% total) and it's very manageable to get at least a B in this class.

The class is boring! Tests are harder than I expected especially the third one. Read the book is a must. He likes to test on details. Though he said we do not have to remember the examples in the book, some questions are from those. Would be helpful if he can tell us what will be in the test.

The material is very dry so its difficult to pay attention. You have to go to class in order to get attendance points with the iclicker. Good guy but he needs to give some hints as to whats on the exam. He emphasizes the slides but still no direction. It' d be nice if he said what to focus on. Its alot of material to cover when youre studying

The class is misleadingly easy, and the tests seem misleadingly easy until you get your grades back and find out you didn't do well. Basically just tells you to study everything for exams and makes the lectures as boring as they could possibly be. I dread going to class and have no motivation to try in it.
He is a food person.

This class is straight forward. Read the book is a must to do well on the exams. His slides are important as well. Lastly, do the homework with some thought and this class should not be hard. It does require a good amount of effort, though.

A boring, straight-forward class. Love is a good guy, but the information is just too dry and repetitive to be interesting. Read the book, review his slides thoroughly, and spare yourself by doing something else during lecture. Impossible to not get an A as long as you are a relatively good student.
Boring lectures. Reading the textbook is mandatory for doing well on exams. Not a bad guy, but could be more helpful in telling you what's on the exams.
Very very easy exams. Just go through the slides and understand every single definition in it. Otherwise, the exams may seem a bit ambiguous.
The class sucks, but gLove is awesome. He is very reasonable and tries to make the class tolerable.

The class is not that interesting. The exams are semi-easy...you just have to memorize the materials taught. I suggest you take all the e.c. opportunity...because just when you think you are going to ace every test...the third exam comes along and it is so much harder than the previous exams!

Most boring class ever. Questions on the exams are hard if you don't memorize every single detail from the PP slides. 3 ridiculous exams of 50 points each make up the entire class. The practice sample exams are pretty easy compared to the real exams.

very easy. very boring. dont really need to pay attention. for exams use the study guide and read over slides. going to class is a must due to EC iclickers. book not needed at all, dont bother. do need a CD though. also has 8pts of experiments u can do.

BADM 310 is just a very boring class, there is nothing wrong with the Professor though. BUT don't leave early he will make a big deal out of it.Your grade will be out of 300 points; 100 per exam. Memorize every single detail on the slides and you will get at least a B. The textbook use is rare (but still needed).

This class could not possibly have more boring material. Prof. Love tries to make it interesting although I don't think it's possible. Go to class for the clickers and to fill in the notes but bring something else to do. Memorize the ppt slides the night before the test and you'll have an A.

Love is a very smart man. He teaches things in ways that people can understand and despite the enormous amounts of material he gives, his tests are fair and if you study, you'll do well or well enough. Iclickers allow you a maximum of 10 pts. extra credit so take advantage of them to help if you do poorly on an exam. But it's an interesting class.

Lecture isn't mandatory but you get a ton of extra credit for going, so do it!  I found it hard to pay attention, so reading the book really helped, but it's not necessary.  Exams are kind of hard but there's enough extra credit to boost your grade almost an entire letter.

Nice guy, very clear with explaining class material. Do not purchase the textbook, all material from exams comes directly from course notes. Gives tons of extra credit that you should take advantage of.

Good at explaining conceptual material (BADM 310 is all conceptual material in case ya didn't know) - 3 exams with averages around 82 to 86. No curve but a possible of +18 ExtraCredit points. Good luck and be respectful.
He really tries to make sure the students learn the material. The extra credit he gives makes this a really easy class. There is just a lot of information to learn for each test.
Nice guy.  The class is pretty easy and there is a ton of extra credit
great prof. excellent in channeling ppl's ideas and thoughts. superb experience!
love you LOVE

Gives out lots of extra credit - DO ALL! Go to class and get clicker credit and do the other ex. credit and it will help your grade.  Exams aren't extremely easy but if you study you will do well enough to get a good grade, especially w/ ex. credit.  Grade based on 3 exams: 100 pts. each for 300 pts. total.  We had 20 points of possible extra credi

Go to class for easy extra credit (clickers) and to watch the videos that are tested on. Don't read the book, just share with a friend so you can watch the CanGo videos before the exam. Just go through the study guide and your slides very thoroughly and you'll be fine. The class is extremely boring, but I don't think it's really his fault.
Would definitley take another class of his.

Relatively easy. I bombed the first test because I thought it would be a piece of cake. Just be sure to study for a few days before the test and you should do fine. almost a full letter grade of extra credit for the class. Lecture can be quite boring, but he at least tries to keep things interesting.

Hes a cool guy. Iclickers are extra credit, but seriously not worth going to class if your good at teaching yourself. I'd just copy notes from a friend and study them alot. 1.5 hrs in that lecture hall is brutal. Overall not that hard, but some people have problems with it.

Only funny when he's not trying to be, but overall a good teacher. Lectures in Lincoln Hall go to crap if the teacher is a pushover but he's strict on talking so it's pretty easy to listen. I give him credit for putting up with 750 kids. Go to class, bring homework/crossword/reading material with, and read over lecture slides for exams.

Only funny when he's not trying to be, but overall a good teacher. Lectures in Lincoln Hall go to crap if the teacher is a pushover but he's strict on talking so it's pretty easy to listen. I give him credit for putting up with 750 kids. Go to class, bring homework/crossword/reading material with, and read over lecture slides for exams.
very entertaining..if you attend lecture then you should do great on exams
Whoever says this guy is hard either never read the lecture notes or is a LAS major. He's so easy, he tries to make a boring subject as interesting as possible, and gives tons of extra credit.

This class just makes a lot of unnecessary technical jargon for common sense concepts.  Very long, boring lectures (which seems to be common among the BADM classes I've taken).  Memorize your notes, and buy the book just for the stupid videos--he asks several questions on those and on the movie clips in class on exams.
Waste of time but it's a mandatory class. 3 exams: just go over your course study guide: no need to buy the text book.

"When I was at Harvard", "Harvard Business Review has an article...", "The Harvard MBA program..." - We aren't stupid just because we went to U of I instead of Harvard!  Quit mentioning it so much!  Easy class, boring material, didn't get much out of lectures but that doesn't mean he's a bad prof.

Really nice, good guy.  His lectures were pretty basic, yet long -- but there's not much he could have done about that.  It's just the material.  The exams were pure application or T/F questions where you weren't sure where the hell the questions came from...
What a waste of time.  The class is unbelievably boring.  As long as you have half a brain you most likely have learned all the material for this class by the time you turn 12.

Enormous class but you really don't need to go to get an A+.  Just read the notes and maybe the book.  Tests are pretty straight forward.  If you do go, bring the DI, a pillow or your check book to do your bills because you will not be able to pay attention the entire time.....BORING!!
Goes through alot of stuff fairly fast and it's really boring, except for the film clips.
This class is a guranteed B, which is not so bad. No need to read the book or do the stupid Cango exercises, memorize each course pkg and youll be fine. He wears pink shirts!
He teaches really, really slow, other than that, class would be interesting, but the slowness makes it really boring.
I like the guy, but to be honest, in this class you can count only on yourself and the book, i didn't find his lectures very helpful, but i would highly recomend to attend them.
I don't know that I have ever been to such a boring lecture.  I appreciate his enthusiasm about the subject but the class dull.

omg, went here just for the purpose of rating this class, and already i have someone who shares my pain....SOOOOO BORING!!!! and common, we are not morons (at least not most of us) we can understand things faster than after 100 different examples...HRR

you know this is one of these classes that you really can't avoid if you're a business major but oh boy what a booooring class!! And i believe this is the BIGGEST class (600+) that i've ever been too. No interest in class whatsoever and small wonder!!!
one sexy beast
Fairly easy class.  Most boring lectures EVER!  Class is pointless as long as you study for test.
No Comments
Class wasn't so bad, but the man is soooo boring.
